CatDescriptText: John Johnson, cab driver, Roberts Street and Dorothy Small, hotel worker, Hill District, were part of Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 13, 1960, pg. 1 with question: "What are the most appealing and least appealing aspects of the Democratic Presidential candidate, Senator John F. Kennedy?"  Mr. Johnson's answer reads: "From his speeches, which are full of spirit, he seems quite likeable."  Mrs. Small's answer reads: "I don't think that he's exceptionally outstanding, but I don't know of anything against him."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Johnson wearing moustache and light colored opened collar shirt with rolled cuffs, standing in front of Mellon Bank, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Dorothy Small wearing dark dress with elbow length sleeves and small bow at waist, standing in front of Thrift Drugs, corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Downtown
